sense.name: a mental conception or idea about something
sense.examples: Different societies have differing notions about the roles of men and women. I have no notion of where I may have left my keys. It's an interesting notion, but can it be tested experimentally?

sense.name: a sudden emotional impulse
sense.examples: In the middle of the meeting we suddenly developed the notion to order a pizza. John acted on his notion to jump into the ocean for a morning swim.

sense.name: small personal items, sundries
sense.commentary: NOTION[+entity][+group][+artifact][+small][+personal][+sundries] Note: usually occurs in the plural form
sense.examples: Jane bought small bottles of shampoo and rinse at the notions counter. Needle and thread are useful notions to have when you travel.
